intro: Ternatea rufescens, commonly known as the red-stemmed fern, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Araliaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Asia and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, clustered leaves. The plant produces clusters of white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in spring. Its foliage is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits. Ternatea rufescens thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
